com.nttdocomo.ui
Class AudioPresenter

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.nttdocomo.ui.AudioPresenter
All Implemented Interfaces:
MediaPresenter
public class AudioPresenter
extends java.lang.Object
implements MediaPresenter

This class defines presenter objects for audio media data.
This MediaPresenter class is the presenter that presents audio media data. By registering a listener, the status of presentation can be obtained.
When media data that cannot be played on the UE is set, the behavior is implementation dependent and UIException may occur.
The setData method and the setSound method are used exclusively for one presenter object. It is impossible to set sound data via the setSound method after setting media data via the setData method and vice versa. When calling the same method several times, only the last data set is valid.

Minimum Specifications:

  • In the minimum specification, setAttribute method does not operate.
  • In the minimum specification, attributes are not to be defined.
  • In the minimum specification, UnsupportedOperationException occurs if the setData method is called.

In the minimum specifications, it is guaranteed that the AUDIO_COMPLETE type event is generated. Generation of any other event type is implementation specific.
When an application has been suspended during playing of audio data, the playback is also halted. In this case, the status is the same as when the stop method is called.

See Also:
MediaSound, MediaData, MediaListener

Method Detail

getAudioPresenter

public static AudioPresenter getAudioPresenter()
This obtains an audio presenter object. The object is in a state in which no media resource is set. Since this method does not secure resources for audio representation, UIException does not occur.

getMediaResource

public MediaResource getMediaResource()
This obtains the currently set media resource.

Specified by:
getMediaResource in interface MediaPresenter
Returns:
An media resource.

play

public void play()
This restarts presentation of media data. If a listener is registered for the start of the data presentation, the listener is started with the event type AUDIO_PLAYING. When the data presentation is completed, the play operation stops automatically. When presentation has stopped and a listener has been registered, the listener is started with the event type AUDIO_COMPLETE. When the play method is called during presentation, the presentation is stopped and restarted from the beginning. Resources for audio presentation are secured when this method is called.

Specified by:
play in interface MediaPresenter
Throws:
UIException - Generated when media data is not set or when the media data is not in the playable state (ILLEGAL_STATE).
UIException - Generated when resources for the audio presentation cannot be secured (NO_RESOURCES or BUSY_RESOURCE).

stop

public void stop()
This stops the presentation of media data. When data presentation has stopped and a listener has been registered, the listener will be started with the event type AUDIO_STOPPED. When this method is called while already stopping, no action is taken.

Specified by:
stop in interface MediaPresenter
Throws:
UIException - Generated when media data is not set or when the media data is not in the playable state (ILLEGAL_STATE).

setData

public void setData(MediaData data)
This sets media data. This may not be supported depending on the UE. Parameters:

Specified by:
setData in interface MediaPresenter
Parameters:
data - Designates media data.
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - Generated when the UE is not supporting this method.
UIException - Generated when this method is being called during presentation (ILLEGAL_STATE).
java.lang.NullPointerException - Generated when null is designated for the parameter "data".
UIException - Generated when media data that is not playable at the UE is designated for the parameter "data" (UNSUPPORTED_FORMAT).

setSound

public void setSound(MediaSound sound)
This sets a media sound.

Parameters:
sound - Designates a media sound.
Throws:
UIException - Generated when this method is called during presentation or when the "use" method has not been called for the sound which is set (ILLEGAL_STATE).
java.lang.NullPointerException - Generated when null is designated for the parameter "data".
UIException - Generated when the media sound that is not playable at the UE is designated for the parameter "sound" (UNSUPPORTED_FORMAT).

setMediaListener

public void setMediaListener(MediaListener listener)
This registers a listener. Only one listener can be registered for a presenter. When this method is called more than once, only the last listener is valid. When "null" is designated, the registration of listener will be cancelled.

Specified by:
setMediaListener in interface MediaPresenter
Parameters:
listener - Designates a listener to be registered.
